bill_title: transfer funds from the special racing revolving fund and the South Dakota-bred racing fund to the Department of Social Services for domestic and sexual abuse shelter programs and to the Department of Education for child development and certain technology enhancement programs and to make an appropriation therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to transfer funds from the special racing revolving fund and the South Dakota-bred racing fund to the Department of Social Services for domestic and sexual abuse shelter programs and to the Department of Education for child development and certain technology enhancement programs and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Commission on Gaming on or about July 15, 1999, shall transfer one hundred twenty-five thousand dollars from the special racing revolving fund and one hundred twenty-five thousand dollars from the South Dakota-bred racing fund to the Department of Social Services to provide grants to qualifying contractors according to the provisions of § § 25-10-26 to 25-10- 33, inclusive. Section 2. The Commission on Gaming on or about July 15, 1999, shall transfer fifty thousand dollars from the special racing revolving fund and fifty thousand dollars from the South Dakota-bred racing fund to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide funding for child development programs. Section 3. The Commission on Gaming on or about July 15, 1999, shall transfer three hundred seventy-five thousand dollars from the special racing revolving fund and six hundred twenty-five thousand dollars from the South Dakota-bred racing fund to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs in order to provide funding for enhancing technology-based capabilities of K-12 schools in the areas of teaching, learning, and network administration. Section 4. There is hereby appropriated the sum of two hundred fifty thousand dollars ($250,000), of other fund expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Social Services and one million one hundred thousand dollars ($1,100,000), of other fund expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs for the expenditure of funds provided in sections 1, 2, and 3 of this Act. Section 5. The secretary of social services and the secretary of education and cultural affairs shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 6. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2000, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.
